results.title: A Real rodeo. Fun fair. Felix out of luck. [compilation]
results.brief_description: A compilation of three short films. 1. A Real rodeo: Roping and typing a steer contest; horse and rider in bucking contest; steer bulldogging; queen of the rodeo. 2. Fun fair: Swing high - swing low; the gypsy’s warning; on the target; merry-go-round; steam-boat swing 3. Felix out of luck: animated cartoon.

results.title: A Rat in the building
results.brief_description: This clever clay animation film centres around a gathering of elderly women neighbours who meet for their weekly gossip. Item number one on the agenda, “rats” (whom one presumes represents men), and those women who are devilish enough to keep them in a building that prohibits their existence. Adapted from a short story by Olga Masters and featuring the voices of Penny Biggins and Gretel Killeen.

results.title: A Rag tapestry by 25 children
results.creator_credit: George Zabriskie, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A series of workshops for children at the Metropolitan Museum of Art reveals the entire process involved in making a rag tapestry. Follows process from initial concept through drawing to production. Using wool scraps the 8-12 year-olds create, at little cost, a colorful 3 x 10 foot tapestry.

results.title: A Race against people: the story of Hong Kong's re-housing programme
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Hong Kong Film Unit
results.brief_description: The story of Hong Kong’s Re-housing Program. The re-settlement of new migrants and other Chinese members of the community in to high-rise housing provided by the authorities at public expense. Commentary by Eamonn Andrews.

results.title: A Question of balance
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall, Peter Montagnon and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this visit to Taiwan Ronald Eyre looks at Chinese religion and finds that the Chinese are Confucians, Taoists, Buddhists or can be all three at once. He explores the concept of yin and yan and the harmony which comes when good and evil are combined in balance. He takes his journey from a look at the local gods to the philosophy of the three accepted religions. The three main aims of the Chinese seem to be to live a long time, to have enough money and to have children, and it is from this that the importance of ancestors derive. He attends a village opera performance, a taoist funeral and explores a new temple which seems to include all three religions.

results.title: A Question of attitude
results.creator_credit: Stuart Glover, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Discusses the problem of finding work for physically handicapped people, showing many examples of successful workers in varied skilled positions. Argues that employers’ reluctance to make positions available is the main difficulty.

results.title: A Queer patient
results.creator_credit: Pu Jia-Xiang and Shanghai Animation Film Studio
results.brief_description: A tale from China centred around the theme of the wolf in sheep’s clothing. A caterpillar admits herself to the animal hospital after becoming ill from eating leaves of protected plants. Unfortunately for her, this is discovered by the medical staff who decide not to let her out. However, the caterpillar metamorphoses into a butterfly and seeks to deceive the hospital staff by playing on the fact that nothing as beautiful as she could do anything destructive. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: A Queen who returned [short version]
results.brief_description: An account of the Queen Mother’s visit to Melbourne and the city’s festivities held for the event. Freatures footage of the Queen Mother at Flinder Street Station, the Exhibition Building, State Swimming Centre and her meeting with some Melbourne dignatories.

results.title: A Queen who returned [B/W]
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: On the 27th of February, Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, arrived at Essendon for a five day visit to Victoria. This film follows Her Majesty through many official functions during her visit including the State Reception, the Queen Elizabeth Stakes at Flemington, the children’s display at the Melbourne Cricket Ground and the memorable State Ball at the Melbourne Town Hall. As an introduction to the film, and as a background to this Royal Visit, we see the City of Melbourne - the old city of the past; the exciting new city of the future; its people and their preparations for the Royal Tour.
